newsitem.title: GERMANY: Swollen rivers flood German town, disrupt traffic.
newsitem.headline: Swollen rivers flood German town, disrupt traffic.

text.p: Rivers swollen by heavy rainfall spilled over their banks in several southwestern German towns on Thursday, blocking roads and disrupting traffic.
One day after authorities suspended shipping on three major Rhine tributaries, water from the Neckar river flooded into the historic town centre of Heidelberg.
Police expected massive traffic jams in Heidelberg because several key streets were closed by the flooding.

Flooding along the Saar river prompted police to close a motorway between Saarbruecken near the French border and Voelklingen. Banks in the centre of Saarbruecken have been urging customers to empty safe deposit boxes in underground vaults.
The Moselle river spilled over its banks in the town of Zell, police said.
